REVIEW_BODY: Katong District houses a array of restaurants, road side eateries and multi-cuisines. One must visit the place to have a feel of the Singapore local culture as well as the melting pot of various cultures and cuisines.

This is an old district on the East side of Singapore. Many of the houses here were built by the Straits chinese many years ago. They are refurbished now and have more character due the colourful exterior.

Furthermore this area is known for its local food. They are lots of shops here selling interesting traditional food, especially the laksa and the nonya rice dumplings.

Traveling with 6,9 and 12 year-olds, Katong was a nice respite from the central district, yet it was close enough to see the sites.

East coast beach is a great day visit within walking distance. There were plenty of food options for my sometimes adventurous/sometimes picky eaters.

REVIEW_TITLE: Tons of Great Bars and Restaurants
REVIEW_BODY: The newly renovated Katong District has become really popular with the locals and tourists. There are a ton of really nice restaurants that cater to all kinds of people. You will find some really nice boutique bars and some lovely local restaurants. One of the most famous if the Katong Laksa place, which has been around for a very long time. Best to go at night to grab dinner.

REVIEW_TITLE: Old style houses and a lot of restaurants
REVIEW_BODY: One would enjoy walking the streets and visiting big shopping malls. There are nice reataurants and food courts. There a tunnels for reaching the beach and park.
Lovely town - a MUST visit place with a different side of Singapore. Rich culture, great food, clean and unique :)

This residential district is one of the most bustling neighbourhood in Singapore. Historical and rich in heritage, there are many restaurants and cafes in colourful shophouses serving Peranakan delicacies.

We're staying in this area and it has some fantastic local food around. The Katong plaza (blue building) has some great food in basement level. Some are indoors in air conditioning and other stalks outside . If you walk along that road there are many little restaurants and it's not far from Parkway Parade shopping centre.
Will like to stay in this area again.

REVIEW_TITLE: Historic, fascinating but not 'boring". Huge variety of sights, smells, people and architecture.
REVIEW_BODY: Just a great area close to every thing, lots to see and do, good place to stay with access to Chinatown and little India.

REVIEW_TITLE: My base point for a trip in singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
I chose Katong area as a base point for my trip in singapore because I liked the beautiful colorful houses. I found it a little bit far and inconvenient to transfer to the city area but this place was not busy so that I felt comfortable.
If you walk for about 15 minutes to Marina parade area, you can enjoy Sea view at east coast park. On the way to the park, at a rental bicycle shop "12 cycle" in Marina parade center, I rented a bike with a child seat and enjoyed cycling at seaside.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place with lots of food!
REVIEW_BODY: We love the convenience that good food is almost everywhere. Parking is a hassle but it's worth taking a stroll in the evening along the pubs, cafes & small shops that gives us the feeling that we are in Penang. Child friendly area, popular with expats & tourists too. The east coast park beach is probably 5 to 10 mins away.

Katong is a place where you can find good food and also see the older version of Singapore with it's heritage trail. Worth exploring and it's not far away from East Coast and also some shopping malls.
There are so many eateries around this srea that you will be spoilt for choice. Every turn is an opportunity for a snack or a meal.
Apart fr the heritage bldgs, there r lots of shops, both traditionally peranakan, as well as quaint cafes, line up katong / joo chiat street ...

During our 1 week long trip to Singapore we stayed at Holiday Inn Katong and had opportunity to explore Katong District. It is well connected to rest of the Singapore with SMRT. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. The list includes legendary places like 328 Katong Laksa and Chin mee Chin (known for serving the traditional Singapore breakfast). There are decent options for shopping also.

The architecture is a pleasant mix of old and new. There is a shore line with beaches within walking distance from the area.

Have a lovely stroll in the evening at Katong. Loads of things to see and people watch too! There are many restaurants, coffee shops, bars, speciality shops, etc. If you need respite from the heat, just head to the shopping mall.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit East Coast Road if you love food
REVIEW_BODY:
Foreigners visiting Singapore may want to drop by East Coast Road. Along the short stretch of road (maybe 800m), you will find all types of cuisine - all neatly lined up in restaurants/cafes along the road. Plus in 112 Katong Mall - situated on same road (just cross the road).

For local food, visit
i. Alibabar Coffee Shop
You must try Fried Hokkien Noodles. A small size plate costs only S$5. We enjoyed it so much my partner (from UK) ordered another plate after his fish and chips! The fish and chips was really yummy too. Fried just right - not oily, or soggy. The black pepper chicken chop was great too. I think no more than S$15/dish. Needless to say, we over ate.

ii. 328 Katong Laksa
Short strands of white noodles (locally referred to as bee hoon) with bits of prawns and thin strands of fish cake cooked in coconut, lemon grass, prawn paste - a rich broth, cooked just right. For me it wasn't that spicy. So they gave a packet of chilli sauce. A small bowl costs about S$4.70.

My suggestion is to order small size ones so that you can sample these local food which are really amongst the best in Singapore. They are located within walking distance hence making it convenient and time-saving.

Take note that Singapore restaurants close early, on average about
9-10 pm. Last order is likely to be more than half hour earlier.

Service is average. Don't expect top notch service excellence. Just be grateful you are served (yes, I am being honestly sarcastic).
We like to stay in this area and enjoy walking around the Shop Houses. It has a lovely traditional feel and there are also modern malls. It is well worth a visit when you are in Singapore.

A great place to walk around and found plenty of authentic buildings, heritage and culture. Lots of shopping and food to be found. Huge amount of photo opportunities. Well worth the time spent in this area.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not pretty and looks like an example of local life
REVIEW_BODY: Very much an area of local life going about it's business. Everything was at ridiculous prices eg shirts at S$5 and lower. No attractive building though. Almost would describe it as an area to visit which is not tourist orientated. Lots of restaurants to choose from if you want to eat.

REVIEW_TITLE: Marine park block 84 most dirty hawker centre
REVIEW_BODY:
Once upon a time it was hard to get people to work as cleaner. After the government suggest salary increase things get better more people join the workforce.
We see more cleaner in the hawker centre it was so pleasant.
However it did not last. The cleaner keep changing every few month and the place become very dirty with paper, chopsticks wraper all over the floor and many myna eating the left over.
No doubt the bird flu is away we should still keep this birds away, we have very short memory. Until something happen we start to panic again.
There might be an issue between the contractor and the cleaner, either don't treat them well or pay them less the worker don't seem to work long keep seeing new cleaner all the time. Sigh......

A residential suburb rooted in wealth and traditionally associated with the Peranakan (indigenous Straits Chinese population of Southeast Asia and Singapore) and Eurasian communities, Katong is a charming picture of old and new, with hip cafes, shopping malls, cool bars and modern eateries situated alongside heritage establishments.
This area is near airport, and it has literally everything. You can have a nice brunch, do shopping, dinner and go for a drink.

Katong has many buildings of distinctive architecture. Take a stroll down East Coast Rd. You can't miss the bright red building that was established in 1925. It was one of the first bakeries known as Katong Bakery & Confectionery. Look out for Rumah Bebe. Admire the Peranakan architecture. Turn into Koon Seng Rd for a row of brightly coloured terrace houses. Don't miss some of the ornate facade. Selfie addicts love this place. After so much walking, be sure to pop into one of the eateries in Katong for a scrumptious meal.

I returned to the Katong District recently for another visit, this time for coffee and ice cream. Timing wasn't the best as it was the middle of the day and really hot and sunny outside. As such we didn't end up doing much in the way of sightseeing (being content with the coffee and ice cream).

A good area to see Baba architecture, e.g. junction of East Coast Rd and Joo Chiat Rd (heart of Katong), the shophouses of the Peranakan culture. The Katong District is a fusion of cultures, a heritage town with a blend of old-world charm and modern style. Some nice places to have a meal or drink. Trendy in places. As well as the main roads wander down some of the sidestreets.
Nice heritage place where you can relax and take photos. Katong has a lot of places with nice food too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Explore this area - local restuarants are gaining new customers.
REVIEW_BODY:
My local friend and his family live in this area, tonight we dined at the Danji Korean BBQ Buffet restaurant in Tanjong Katong Rd.

The BBQ was cooked by the kids at the table, the meat and vegetables were matched by the sauces and kimchee - it was a perfect meal....I think my favourite was the chicken thighs cooked with kimchee.

Recommend this Joo Chiat Rd, Haig Rd, Tanjong Rd and East Coast Rd for something different - I'm sure you will find a local restaurant to suit.
This area is not yet developed like other ares.This has that old look.There are lots of eating places.Nothing much to see.
